decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site Plan; Site Location Plan; Existing Rear Elevation (05022024); Existing - A-A Section & Existing Front Elevation (05022024); Existing - Floor Plan (05022024); Proposed - HVAC Plan (05022024); Proposed - Rear Elevation (05022024); Proposed - A-A Section & Proposed Front Elevation (05022024)
Condition : 3 - Hours of Use - The use hereby permitted shall operate only during operating house of the premises on any day.

Condition : 4 - The noise levels associated with the mechanical extraction system shall comply with those stipulated in the Venta Acoustic, Noise Impact Assessment Report VA4726.230519.NIA, dated 25 May 2023.

Reason: To protect the amenities of the occupiers in the local vicinity.

Condition : 5 - Odour from the new extraction and odour control units shall be designed and installed, to comply with the EMAQ Risk Assessment for High Level Odour Control and that cooking odour is not detectable to affect other premises. The system shall be fully operational when the premises is in use and maintained as directed by manufacturer's instructions.

Reason:  To protect the amenities of the occupiers in the local vicinity.

Condition : 6 - No obstruction or cowl is to be fitted above the extract opening. Flexible couplings and mountings are to be used between the ductwork and the walls so there is no transmission of vibration.


Reason:  To protect the amenities of the occupiers in the local vicinity.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

  i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
  ii) The application was approved with an agreed etension of time.
